languages.text: "А чему вы удивляетесь?! Разве когда-то офицеры поступали с нами иначе?!" {n}Новый голос, наждачно-резкий, рвет гудение толпы. Его хозяин оборван и грязен, а в глазах горит лихорадочный блеск. Своими словами он воспаляет разумы черни, словно пирующая на ране гниль. Гниль глумливо визжит:{/n} "Это потому что вы их боитесь, а они вас — нет!"

traits.locale_text: "А чему вы удивляетесь?! Разве когда-то офицеры поступали с нами иначе?!" {n}Новый голос, наждачно-резкий, рвет гудение толпы. Его хозяин оборван и грязен, а в глазах горит лихорадочный блеск. Своими словами он воспаляет разумы черни, словно пирующая на ране гниль. Гниль глумливо визжит:{/n} "Это потому что вы их боитесь, а они вас — нет!"

languages.text: "Why are you surprised? Have the officers ever treated us otherwise?" {n}A new voice, sandpaper-rough, tears through the rumbling of the crowd. Its owner is ragged and filthy, and a feverish gleam burns in his eyes. His words inflame the people's minds, like rot feasting upon a wound. Rot cries out mockingly,{/n} "That's because you're afraid of them, but they're not afraid of you!"
languages.original_text: "А чему вы удивляетесь?! Разве когда-то офицеры поступали с нами иначе?!" {n}Новый голос, наждачно-резкий, рвет гудение толпы. Его хозяин оборван и грязен, а в глазах горит лихорадочный блеск. Своими словами он воспаляет разумы черни, словно пирующая на ране гниль. Гниль глумливо визжит:{/n} "Это потому что вы их боитесь, а они вас — нет!"

traits.locale_text: "Why are you surprised? Have the officers ever treated us otherwise?" {n}A new voice, sandpaper-rough, tears through the rumbling of the crowd. Its owner is ragged and filthy, and a feverish gleam burns in his eyes. His words inflame the people's minds, like a rot feasting upon a wound. This Rot cries out mockingly,{/n} "That is because you're afraid of them, but they are not afraid of you!"

"Why are you surprised?! Have officers ever treated us differently?!" {n}A new voice, sandpaper-rough, rips through the rumbling of the crowd. Its owner is ragged and filthy, and a feverish gleam burns in his eyes. He is toxic and balding, like a carpet of mildew. Mildew shrieks mockingly:{/n} "That is because you're afraid of them and they are not afraid of you!"

"Why are you surprised? Have the officers ever treated us otherwise?" {n}A new voice, sandpaper-rough, tears through the rumbling of the crowd. Its owner is ragged and filthy, and a feverish gleam burns in his eyes. His words inflame the people's minds, like rot feasting upon a wound. Rot cries out mockingly,{/n} "That's because you're afraid of them, but they're not afraid of you!"

"Why are you surprised? Have the officers ever treated us otherwise?" {n}A new voice, sandpaper-rough, tears through the rumbling of the crowd. Its owner is ragged and filthy, and a feverish gleam burns in his eyes. He is toxic and balding, like a carpet made of mildew. He cries out mockingly:{/n} "That is because you're afraid of them, but they are not afraid of you!"

Its owner is ragged and filthy, and a feverish gleam burns in his eyes. His words inflame the people's minds, like rot feasting upon a wound. Rot cries out mockingly,{/n} "That's because you're afraid of them, but they're not afraid of you!"

Its owner is ragged and filthy, and a feverish gleam burns in his eyes. His words inflame the people's minds, like a rot feasting upon a wound. This Rot cries out mockingly,{/n} "That is because you're afraid of them, but they are not afraid of you!"

"Why are you surprised? Have the officers ever treated us otherwise?" {n}A new voice, sandpaper-rough, tears through the rumbling of the crowd. Its owner is ragged and filthy, and a feverish gleam burns in his eyes. His words inflame the people's minds, like rot feasting upon a wound. Rot cries out mockingly,{/n} "That's because you're afraid of them, but they're not afraid of you!"

"Why are you surprised? Have the officers ever treated us otherwise?" {n}A new voice, sandpaper-rough, tears through the rumbling of the crowd. Its owner is ragged and filthy, and a feverish gleam burns in his eyes. His words inflame the people's minds, like rot feasting upon a wound. Rot cries out mockingly,{/n} "That's because you're afraid of them, but they're not afraid of you!"

languages.text: "Warum seid Ihr überrascht? Haben uns die Offiziere jemals anders behandelt?" {n}Eine neue Stimme, rau wie Sandpapier, durchschneidet das Murmeln der Menge. Ihr Besitzer ist in Lumpen gehüllt. In seinen Augen brennt ein fiebriges Glanz. Seine Worte ergreifen von den Leuten Besitz wie Eiter von einer offenen Wunde. Fäulnis ruft spöttisch:{/n} "Das liegt daran, dass Ihr Angst vor ihnen habt, sie aber nicht vor Euch!"
languages.original_text: "Why are you surprised? Have the officers ever treated us otherwise?" {n}A new voice, sandpaper-rough, tears through the rumbling of the crowd. Its owner is ragged and filthy, and a feverish gleam burns in his eyes. His words inflame the people's minds, like rot feasting upon a wound. Rot cries out mockingly,{/n} "That's because you're afraid of them, but they're not afraid of you!"

traits.locale_text: "Weshalb seid Ihr überrascht? Haben die Offiziere uns jemals anders behandelt?" {n}Eine neue Stimme, rau wie Sandpapier, dringt durch das Murmeln der Menge. Ihr Besitzer ist heruntergekommen und schmutzig, und in seinen Augen glimmt ein fiebriges Feuer. Er ist toxisch und verliert seine Haare, wie ein Teppich aus Mehltau. Und dieser Mehltau schreit höhnisch:{/n} "Das ist, weil Ihr Angst vor ihnen habt, aber sie haben keine Angst vor Euch!"

languages.text: «¿De qué os sorprendéis? ¿Es que alguna vez nos han tratado de otra forma los guardias?». {n}Una nueva voz, áspera como la lija, atraviesa el zumbido de la multitud. Su dueño está harapiento y sucio, y sus ojos arden con un brillo febril. Sus palabras impregnan las mentes de la gente, como una infección en una herida abierta. Carroña clama con tono burlón:{/n} «Es porque vosotros les tenéis miedo, ¡pero ellos a vosotros no!».
languages.original_text: "Why are you surprised? Have the officers ever treated us otherwise?" {n}A new voice, sandpaper-rough, tears through the rumbling of the crowd. Its owner is ragged and filthy, and a feverish gleam burns in his eyes. His words inflame the people's minds, like rot feasting upon a wound. Rot cries out mockingly,{/n} "That's because you're afraid of them, but they're not afraid of you!"

traits.locale_text: «¿De qué os sorprendéis? ¿Es que alguna vez nos han tratado de otra forma los guardias?». {n}Una nueva voz, áspera como la lija, atraviesa el zumbido de la multitud. Su dueño está harapiento y sucio, y sus ojos arden con un brillo febril. Es tóxico y pierde pelo, como una alfombra de moho. Este Moho clama con tono burlón:{/n} «Es porque vosotros les tenéis miedo, ¡pero ellos a vosotros no!».

languages.text: 「なぜ驚く？士官からの扱いなんて、いつもこんなものだろう？」{n}群衆のざわめきを切り裂くように、紙やすりのようにザラついた別の声が響く。その声の主は身なりが汚く不潔で、熱狂的な輝きが宿っている。彼の言葉は、まるで傷口を腐らせるように、人々の心を燃え上がらせる。腐敗はあざ笑うように叫んだ。{/n}「それはお前達が奴らを恐れているが、奴らはお前達を恐れていないせいだ！」
languages.original_text: "Why are you surprised? Have the officers ever treated us otherwise?" {n}A new voice, sandpaper-rough, tears through the rumbling of the crowd. Its owner is ragged and filthy, and a feverish gleam burns in his eyes. His words inflame the people's minds, like rot feasting upon a wound. Rot cries out mockingly,{/n} "That's because you're afraid of them, but they're not afraid of you!"

traits.locale_text: 「なぜ驚く？士官からの扱いなんて、いつもこんなものだろう？」{n}群衆のざわめきを切り裂くように、紙やすりのようにザラついた別の声が響く。その声の主は身なりが汚く不潔で、熱っぽい光が目に焼き付いている。毒々しく禿げ上がり、カビでできたカーペットのようだ。そのカビが茶化すように大声をあげた。{/n}「それはお前達が奴らを恐れているが、奴らはお前達を恐れていないせいだ！」

languages.text: “这有什么可惊讶的？那些军官不就是这么对待我们的吗？不是吗？”{n}新的声音传来了，听起来像粗糙的砂纸，撕裂了人群的隆隆声。声音的主人衣衫褴褛，脏污不堪，双眼中燃烧着狂热的光芒。他的话语起到了火上浇油的作用，仿佛脓疮在伤口上不断溃烂一样。那块“脓疮”嘲弄地喊了起来。{/n}“他们凭什么敢这么做？就凭你们怕他们！他们根本不怕你们！”
languages.original_text: "Why are you surprised? Have the officers ever treated us otherwise?" {n}A new voice, sandpaper-rough, tears through the rumbling of the crowd. Its owner is ragged and filthy, and a feverish gleam burns in his eyes. His words inflame the people's minds, like rot feasting upon a wound. Rot cries out mockingly,{/n} "That's because you're afraid of them, but they're not afraid of you!"

traits.locale_text: “这有什么可惊讶的？那些军官不就是这么对待我们的吗？不是吗？”{n}新的声音传来了，听起来像粗糙的砂纸，撕裂了人群的隆隆声。声音的主人衣衫褴褛，脏污不堪，双眼中燃烧着狂热的光芒。那是个秃顶的人，浑身有毒，仿佛一张霉菌织成的毯子。那张“霉毯”嘲弄地喊了起来。{/n}“他们凭什么敢这么做？就凭你们怕他们，可他们却不怕你们！”

languages.text: « Cela vous surprend ? Les officiers nous ont-ils déjà traités autrement ? » {n}Une nouvelle voix, rugueuse comme du papier de verre, déchire le brouhaha de la foule. Son propriétaire est chauve, dépenaillé et sale, mais son regard est fiévreux. Ses paroles enflamment l'esprit du peuple, le contaminent à l'image de la gangrène dans une plaie infectée. Pourriture crie d'un air moqueur,{/n} « Tout ça parce que vous avez peur d'eux, alors qu'ils n'ont pas peur de nous ! »
languages.original_text: "Why are you surprised? Have the officers ever treated us otherwise?" {n}A new voice, sandpaper-rough, tears through the rumbling of the crowd. Its owner is ragged and filthy, and a feverish gleam burns in his eyes. His words inflame the people's minds, like rot feasting upon a wound. Rot cries out mockingly,{/n} "That's because you're afraid of them, but they're not afraid of you!"

traits.locale_text: « Cela vous surprend ? Les officiers nous ont-ils déjà traités autrement ? » {n}Une nouvelle voix, rugueuse comme du papier de verre, déchire le brouhaha de la foule. Son propriétaire est chauve, dépenaillé et sale, mais son regard est fiévreux. Il est toxique, comme un tapis de moisissure. Ce Moisissure crie d'un air moqueur,{/n} « Tout ça parce que vous avez peur d'eux, alors qu'ils n'ont pas peur de nous ! »

languages.text: "Neden şaşırdınız? Subaylar bize hiç farklı davrandı mı?" {n}Kalabalığın gürültüsünü zımpara gibi sert, yepyeni bir ses yarıp geçiyor. Sesin sahibi, paçavralar ve pislik içindeki birisi. Gözlerinde heyecan dolu bir parıltı alevleniyor. Sözleri, açık bir yara üzerinde ziyafet çeken çürük misali insanların zihinlerini kışkırtıyor. Çürük, alay edercesine bağırıyor.{/n} "Çünkü onlardan korkuyorsunuz ama onlar sizden korkmuyor!"
languages.original_text: "Why are you surprised? Have the officers ever treated us otherwise?" {n}A new voice, sandpaper-rough, tears through the rumbling of the crowd. Its owner is ragged and filthy, and a feverish gleam burns in his eyes. His words inflame the people's minds, like rot feasting upon a wound. Rot cries out mockingly,{/n} "That's because you're afraid of them, but they're not afraid of you!"
